Title and abstract.title: Why Are More American Teenagers Than Ever Suffering From Severe Anxiety?
Title and abstract.abstract: Parents, therapists and schools are struggling to figure out whether helping anxious teenagers means protecting them or pushing them to face their fears.

Title and abstract.title: The Prophet of Germany’s New Right
Title and abstract.abstract: From a tiny village in the country’s rural east, a leading nationalist intellectual builds a vision for the future of his movement across Europe.

Title and abstract.title: In Northern Minnesota, Two Economies Square Off: Mining vs. Wilderness
Title and abstract.abstract: Proposed mines near the Boundary Waters have become the latest front in the fight over who gets to profit from America’s natural resources.

Title and abstract.title: Philip Pullman Returns to His Fantasy World
Title and abstract.abstract: After 17 years, the author of the trilogy “His Dark Materials” carries on the story of one of literature’s most indelible heroines.

Title and abstract.title: Are Politicians Responsible for Their ‘Base,’ or Is It the Other Way Around?
Title and abstract.abstract: Republican leaders used to worry about the limits of their base. Now they find themselves increasingly at its mercy.

Title and abstract.title: Can My Cat Go Out if He Bullies Other Cats?
Title and abstract.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on balancing competing rights to happiness and why motives matter when seeking to punish others for wrongdoing.

Title and abstract.title: Cooking Duck Not With Love but With Pleasure
Title and abstract.abstract: The restaurant favorite is just as easy to make at home.

Title and abstract.title: The Photographer Who Saw America’s Monuments Hiding in Plain Sight
Title and abstract.abstract: Lee Friedlander provided an early study of our national fascination with statuary.

Title and abstract.title: Dylan Marron Wants to Know Why People Hate One Another
Title and abstract.abstract: The podcaster on not calling people “trolls,” being combative on the internet and why he genuinely loves talking to people.

Title and abstract.title: New Sentences: From Dan Brown’s ‘Origin: A Novel’
Title and abstract.abstract: Brown’s books continue turning great triumphs of human thought into props, toys and set-dressing.

Title and abstract.title: Behind the Cover: 10.15.17
Title and abstract.abstract: For this issue, a look at the struggle to help anxious teenagers.

Title and abstract.title: Judge John Hodgman on Getting the Most Out of Cash-Back Rewards
Title and abstract.abstract: Let go of your childhood blankey of a debit card.

Title and abstract.title: How to Pawn Valuables
Title and abstract.abstract: Make sure your things look well-cared for. Tell the story if you have a specific, compelling monetary need.

Title and abstract.title: Letter of Recommendation: Dunking
Title and abstract.abstract: Dunking has a long and ritualized tradition and a formal name popularly known as intinction.

Title and abstract.title: If the Boy Had Pneumonia, Why Did He Have Odd Sores on His Body?
Title and abstract.abstract: A 5-year-old has two seemingly unrelated symptoms, but if they were connected, it might mean serious trouble.
